#Text=Michoel Fisher
#Text=Dayan Michoel Fisher ( c. 1910 – January 7 , 2004 ) was a distinguished Orthodox rabbi , orator and exceptional Talmudic scholar , with complete mental mastery of the entire Talmud .
#Text=Early years

#Text=Born sometime between 1908 and 1912 ; he was always unsure of his date of birth ; in Grodno , then Imperial Russia , Dayan Fisher was the seventh of fourteen children born to the professional fundraiser of the Grodno yeshiva .
#Text=He claimed to have shared a bench in the Grodno Cheder with Meyer Lansky .
#Text=It is no exaggeration to state that Dayan Fisher studied under the most illustrious institutions and figures of his generation .
#Text=He was a pupil of the renowned Rabbi Shimon Shkop in Grodno yeshiva , as well as Rabbi Boruch Ber Leibowitz in Kamenetz yeshiva .
#Text=Dayan Fisher went to Radin yeshiva in his late teens , serving the world-famous Chofez Chaim as carer and personal assistant and was one of a select group who prayed daily in his house .
#Text=He also studied in Białystok yeshiva and under Rabbi Chaim Ozer Grodzinski of Vilna .
#Text=In 1930 Dayan Fisher went to Mir yeshiva , staying for six years .
#Text=Rabbinical career
#Text=Dayan Fisher was appointed Rabbi of a small shul in Warsaw in 1936 , where he rapidly acquired a name as an impressive speaker in the " Litvishe " ( Lithuanian Jewish ) style .

#Text=He married Sarah Miriam Wloski of Łomża in June 1937 , whose father worked as a Shochet in England , following her to England the same year through the rescue efforts of Rabbi Dr Solomon Schonfeld .
#Text=Dayan Fisher thus escaped the impending Holocaust , yet his entire family was wiped out except for a younger brother who escaped from the Warsaw Ghetto and joined the partisans .
#Text=When Rabbi Fisher arrived in England , the Federation of Synagogues , with some 68 affiliated synagogues , was the largest synagogal body in the United Kingdom , serving some 50,000 souls .
#Text=He became Rabbi of the Alie Street Federation synagogue in London 's East End in 1939 .
#Text=In 1940 , he took over as Rabbi of Yavne synagogue in Hackney , which he led until 1970 .
#Text=In 1966 , Dayan Fisher formed the Federation Beis Din , which he built up into a significant and respected force .

#Text=As a result of his numerous communal activities and in recognition of his phenomenal Talmudic scholarship , Dayan Fisher became the " Rav Rashi " of the Federation of Synagogues in 1969 following Rabbi Dr Eliezer Kirzner .
#Text=Upon his retirement in 1980 , he retained the post with the addition of the appellation " emeritus " .
#Text=Dayan Fisher moved with his wife to Edgware in the 1970s , where they became well-known and popular figures .
#Text=His wife 's death in 1987 was a severe blow , yet he continued to speak and teach for the next decade and a half , well into his 90s .
#Text=Serving as the Chairman of the Federation of Synagogues Rabbinate for many years , Dayan Fisher 's relationship with Federation lay leaders was not always happy .
#Text=He felt that he and his rabbinic colleagues were often mistreated and undervalued by their constituents , who did n’t recognise the tremendous talent and knowledge of their Rabbis .
#Text=Although unbending in his firm old-world Orthodoxy , he was always courteous to those with different views and practices .
#Text=An ardent religious supporter of Israel , he was a senior figure in UK Mizrachi for many years , and visited Israel often .
#Text=Dayan Fisher died on January 7 , 2004 in London , survived by two daughters , three grandchildren and one great-granddaughter .
#Text=One son-in-law is Elkan Levy , ex-president of the United Synagogue .
#Text=Scholarship and intellect
#Text=Dayan Fisher was an intellectually brilliant figure , possessing a photographic memory and an encyclopaedic knowledge of the Talmud and other Rabbinic texts .
#Text=He knew the 7000 pages of the Talmud by heart , word for word , and could provide the page , line and exact wording for any Talmudic reference instantly .
#Text=He was also an inspiring orator , erudite , humorous , thought provoking and possessing great wit .
#Text=In later life , Dayan Fisher remarked that in retrospect , he was not ' cut out ' for the Rabbinate , but rather as a teacher , scholar and educator .
#Text=He liked nothing better than teaching and learning Talmud .
#Text=In a eulogy , Dayan Fisher was described by Dayan Lichtenstein , current head of the Federation Beth Din [ 1 ] , as a great Talmudic scholar .
#Text=" He studied the Torah every time as if he were learning it for the first time ...

#Text=Chief Rabbi Sir Jonathan Sacks said in tribute ,  Dayan Michoel Fisher was one of the great links between Anglo-Jewry and the world of Lithuanian Jewish piety " .

column1: #Text=Dayan Fisher published Ateres Mordechai , a commentary to Pirkei Avos in London in 1953 .
